title._content: Image taken from page 356 of 'Forest Scenes and Incidents in the wilds of North America, being a diary of a winter's route from Halifax to the Canadas, and during four months residence in the woods on the border of Lakes Huron and Simcoe'

description._content: Image taken from: Title: "Forest Scenes and Incidents in the wilds of North America, being a diary of a winter's route from Halifax to the Canadas, and during four months residence in the woods on the border of Lakes Huron and Simcoe" Author: HEAD, George - Sir Shelfmark: "British Library HMNTS 792.f.9." Page: 356 Place of Publishing: London Date of Publishing: 1829 Issuance: monographic Identifier: 001629123 Note: The colours, contrast and appearance of these illustrations are unlikely to be true to life. They are derived from scanned images that have been enhanced for machine interpretation and have been altered from their originals.
